DataElement.preferredName: HPV-Mediated p16-Positive Oropharyngeal Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Clinical Regional Lymph Node N Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for p16-positive oropharyngeal carcinoma based on information obtained from the date of cancer diagnosis until the start of definitive treatment, or within four months (whichever is shorter), using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Oropharynx Neoplasm CDKN2A-p16 Positive Clinical N Category
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The part of the pharynx between the soft palate and the upper portion of the epiglottis._A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._Indicates that CDKN2A-p16 expression has been detected in a sample._Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The part of the pharynx between the soft palate and the upper portion of the epiglottis.:A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Concepts.definition: The part of the pharynx between the soft palate and the upper portion of the epiglottis.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Indicates that CDKN2A-p16 expression has been detected in a sample.:Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:One criteria of the TNM staging system.  N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: Indicates that CDKN2A-p16 expression has been detected in a sample.
Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 4/9/18 tt released. 2/15/18 tt created for standardization.

ValueDomain.preferredName: HPV-Mediated (p16-Positive) Oropharyngeal Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 N Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of HPV-mediated (p16-positive) oropharyngeal cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. Oropharyngeal cancers which are p16-negative are staged according to the classification for oropharynx (p16-negative) and hypopharynx cancers. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: HPV-Mediated (p16-Positive) Oropharyngeal Cancer cN3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: HPV-Mediated (p16-Positive) Oropharyngeal Cancer cN3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: HPV-mediated (p16-positive) oropharyngeal cancer with lymph node(s) metastasis, larger than 6 cm. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: HPV-Mediated (p16-Positive) Oropharyngeal Cancer cN3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: HPV-mediated (p16-positive) oropharyngeal cancer with lymph node(s) metastasis, larger than 6 cm. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: HPV-Mediated (p16-Positive) Oropharyngeal Cancer cN2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: HPV-Mediated (p16-Positive) Oropharyngeal Cancer cN2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: HPV-mediated (p16-positive) oropharyngeal cancer with contralateral or bilateral lymph node metastasis, none larger than 6 cm. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: HPV-Mediated (p16-Positive) Oropharyngeal Cancer cN2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: HPV-mediated (p16-positive) oropharyngeal cancer with contralateral or bilateral lymph node metastasis, none larger than 6 cm. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: HPV-Mediated (p16-Positive) Oropharyngeal Cancer cN1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: HPV-Mediated (p16-Positive) Oropharyngeal Cancer cN1 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: HPV-mediated (p16-positive) oropharyngeal cancer with metastasis in one or more ipsilateral lymph nodes, none larger than 6 cm. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: HPV-Mediated (p16-Positive) Oropharyngeal Cancer cN1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: HPV-mediated (p16-positive) oropharyngeal cancer with metastasis in one or more ipsilateral lymph nodes, none larger than 6 cm. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: HPV-Mediated (p16-Positive) Oropharyngeal Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: HPV-Mediated (p16-Positive) Oropharyngeal Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: HPV-mediated (p16-positive) oropharyngeal cancer in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: HPV-Mediated (p16-Positive) Oropharyngeal Cancer pNX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: HPV-mediated (p16-positive) oropharyngeal cancer in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: HPV-Mediated (p16-Positive) Oropharyngeal Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: HPV-Mediated (p16-Positive) Oropharyngeal Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: HPV-mediated (p16-positive) oropharyngeal cancer with no metastasis to regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: HPV-Mediated (p16-Positive) Oropharyngeal Cancer pN0 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: HPV-mediated (p16-positive) oropharyngeal cancer with no metastasis to regional lymph nodes. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
